definition: (Internet slang) to attack verbally/to publicly criticize/to call out

sentences.english: God heard their complaint and promised to supply them with both meat and bread.
sentences.chinese: 神聽見他們的怨懟之聲，於是承諾賜給他們食物。

sentences.english: Against the god who had abandoned him all those years ago.
sentences.chinese: 他將找那位父神，一洩多年前遺棄自己的怨懟。

sentences.english: Resentment of those emotions, but on their own dissatisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 那些怨懟的情緒，只是對自己的不滿。

sentences.english: An older people often find that the side against people less and less.
sentences.chinese: 一個長大的人往往會發現身邊可以怨懟的人越來越少。

sentences.english: Your grudges③, resentments④, frustrations and jealousies will finally disappear.
sentences.chinese: 你的怨懟，憤恨，沮喪和嫉妒最終都會消失。

sentences.english: It is worth noting that he did not react against the king, the one who signed the new law.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我們要留意的是，他沒有對王產生怨懟之心。

sentences.english: Chest inside of disaffection and disgust the Dui scatter an greater half, heads anew reply to settle clearly.
sentences.chinese: 胸腔裏的不滿和怨懟散了一大半，頭腦又回覆了清明。

sentences.english: Is afraid to him is merely resent a Dui rage to dislike.
sentences.chinese: 對他怕是隻有怨懟憤恨吧。

definition: to be reluctant to give up a post
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
to have talent but no opportunity (idiom)/to be an unrecognized talent
separated in life and death/to part for ever
to turn a blind eye to
